data.title: Gender and changing generational relations: Spouse choice in Indonesia
data.meta_description: Many Asian societies are undergoing a nuptiality transition that is not only tied integrally to other aspects of family organization, but is also often mor
data.text:
Caldwell, John C. 1982. Theory of Fertility Decline. London: Academic Press.

Caldwell, John C., P. H. Reddy, and Pat Caldwell. 1983. “The Causes of Marriage Change in South India.” Population Studies 37:343–61.

— 1985. “Education Transition in Rural South India.” Population and Development Review 11(1):29–51.

Casterline, John. 1980. “The Determinants of Rising Female Age at Marriage: Taiwan, 1905–1976.” Unpublished doctoral dissertation, University of Michigan.

Cherlin, Andrew and Aphichat Chamratrithirong. 1988. “Variations in Marriage Patterns in Central Thailand.” Demography 25(3):337–54.

Cherlin, Andrew, Thomas Fricke, Peter Smith, and Lita Domingo. 1984. “Family Influence on the Timing of Marriage: Evidence from Four Asian Socities.” Asian Marriage Survey Team Report, Draft Document. Honolulu: East-West Center.

—. 1985. “Education and Age at Marriage: Evidence from Four Asian Societies.” Asian Marriage Survey Team Report, First Draft. Honolulu: East-West Center.

Freedman, Ronald. 1983. “Theories of Fertility Decline.” Paper presented at the annual meetings of the Population Association of America, Pittsburgh.

Fricke, Thomas, Sabiha Syed, and Peter Smith. 1986. “Rural Punjabi Social Organization and Marriage Timing Strategies in Pakistan.” Demography 23(4):489–508.

Geertz, Hildred. 1961. The Javanese Family. New York: Free Press.

Goode, William J. 1963. World Revolution and Family Patterns. New York: Free Press.

— 1982. The Family. Englewood Cliffs, NJ: Prentice-Hall.

Goody, Jack. 1973. “Bridewea1th and Dowry in Africa and Eurasia.” Pp. 1–58 in Bridewealth and Dowry, edited by Jack Goody and S. J. Tambiah. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.

Greenhalgh, Susan. 1985. “Sexual Stratification: The Other Side of ‘Growth with Equity’ in East Asia.” Population and Development Review 11(June):265–314.

Hoffman, Saul D. and Greg J. Duncan. 1988. “Multinomial and Conditional Logit Discrete-Choice Models.” Demography 25(3):415–27.

Hull, Terence. 1987. “Fertility Decline in Indonesia: An Institutionalist Interpretation.” Paper presented at the annual meetings of the Population Association of America, Chicago.

Hull, Terence and Valerie Hull. 1985. “Changing Marriage Behavior in Java.” Paper presented at the annual meetings of the Population Asssociation of America, Boston.

Hull, Valerie. 1975. “Fertility, Socioeconomic Status, and the Position of Women in a Javanese Village.” Unpublished doctoral dissertation, Australian National University, Canberra.

Hull, Valerie. 1985. “Marriage and Divorce in Java: Social Class and Social Change.” Paper presented at the Asian Regional Conference on Women and the Household, New Delhi.

Jay, Robert R. 1969. Javanese Villagers: Social Relations in Rural Modjokuto. Cambridge: MIT Press.

Keyfitz, Nathan. 1985. “An East Javanese Village in 1953 and 1985: Observations on Development.” Population and Development Review 11(4):695–719.

King, Elizabeth M., Jane Peterson, Sri Moertiningsih Adioetomo, Lita Domingo, and Sabiha Syed. 1986. “The Status of Women and Fertility: Intergenerational Change in Three Asian Countries." Paper presented at the Rockefeller Foundation Workshop on Women’s Status and Fertility, Mount Kisco, NY.

Koentjaraningrat, R. M. 1960. “The Javanese of South Central Java.” Pp. 88–115 in Social Structure in Southeast Asia, edited by George P. Murdock. Chicago: Quadrangle.

Maddala, G. S. 1983. Limited-Dependent and Qualitative Variables in Econometrics. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.

Mason, Karen Oppenheim. 1984. “The Status of Women: Conceptual and Methodological Issues in Demographic Studies.” Sociological Forum 1(2):284–300.

McDonald, Peter. 1985. “Social Organization and Nuptiality in Developing Societies.” Pp, 64–86 in Reproductive Change in Developing Countries, edited by John Cleland and John Hobcraft. New York: Oxford University Press.

McNicoll, Geoffrey and Masri Singarimbun. 1983. Fertility Decline in Indonesia. Washington, DC: National Academy Press.

National Research Council. 1987. “Recent Trends in Fertility and Mortality in Indonesia.” Honolulu: East-West Center.

Ortner, Sherry. 1981. “Gender and Sexuality in Hierarchical Societies: The Case of Polynesia and Some Comparative Implications.” Pp. 359–409 in Sexual Meanings: The Cultural Construction of Gender and Sexuality, edited by Sherry Ortner and Harriet Whitehead. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.

Peacock, J. L. 1973. Indonesia: An Anthropological Perspective. Pacific Palisades: Goodyear.

Rindfuss, Ronald and S. Philip Morgan. 1983. “Marriage, Sex and the First Birth Interval: The Quiet Revolution in Asia.” Population and Development Review 9(2)259–78.

Rubin, Gayle. 1975. “The Traffic In Women: Notes towards a Political Economy of Sex.” Pp. 157–210 in Toward an Anthropology of Women, edited by Rayana Reiter. New York: Monthly Review Press.

Salaff, Janet W. 1981. Working Daughters of Hong Kong: Filial Piety or Power in the Family? Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.

Shorter, Edward. 1975. The Making of the Modern Family. New York: Basic Books.

Singarimbun, Masri and Chris Manning. 1974. “Marriage and Divorce in Mojolama.” Indonesia 17:67–85.

Smith, Herbert. 1986. “Theory and Research on the Status of Women and Fertility: Some Necessary Linkages.” Paper presented at the Rockefeller Foundation Workshop on Women’s Status and Fertility, Mount Kisco, NY.

Smith, Peter. 1980. “Asian Marriage Patterns in Transition,” Journal of Family History. 5(1):58–96.

Taj, Anju Malhotra. 1990. “Gender, Generational Relations and Marriage Patterns in Indonesia.” Unpublished doctoral dissertation, University of Michigan.

Tambiah, Stanley J. 1973. “Dowry and Bridewealth and the Property Rights of Women in South Asia.” Pp. 59–169 in Bridewealth and Dowry, edited by J. Goody and S. J. Tambiah. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.

Thornton, Arland, Ming-Cheng Chang, and Te-Hsiung Sun. 1984. “Social and Economic Change, Intergenerational Relationships, and Family Formation in Taiwan.” Demography 21(4):475–99.

Thornton, Arland, Ronald Freedman, Te-Hsiung Sun and Ming-Cheng Chang. 1986. “Intergenerational Relations and Reproductive Behavior in Taiwan.” Demography 23(2):185–97.

United Nations. 1988. First Marriage: Patterns and Determinants. New York: United Nations.

Whyte, Martin. 1978. The Status ofWomen in Preindustrial Societies. Princeton: Princeton University Press.

Williams, Linda B. 1990. Development, Demography, and Family Decision-Making: The Status of Women in Rural Java. Boulder: Westview.

Wolf, Diane. 1988. “Female Autonomy, the Family and Industrialization in Java.” Journal of Family Issues 9(1):85–105.
